snippet: The State Supreme Judicial Court ruled Wednesday that a law prohibiting the secret photographing of nude or partly nude people who could reasonably expect privacy does not apply to “upskirt” photos taken of clothed people in public.
abstract: Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court rules that a law prohibiting the secret photographing of nude or partly nude people who could reasonably expect privacy does not apply to so-called upskirt photos taken of people in public.
lead_paragraph: The State Supreme Judicial Court ruled Wednesday that a law prohibiting the secret photographing of nude or partly nude people who could reasonably expect privacy does not apply to “upskirt” photos taken of clothed people in public.

headline.main: Massachusetts: Ruling Favors Man Accused of Taking ‘Upskirt’ Images
headline.print_headline: Massachusetts: Ruling Favors Man Accused of Taking ‘Upskirt’ Images
